Bodies found in the Seine: Two criminal investigations deepen the mystery
subhead: The four bodies discovered on Wednesday near the Pont de Choisy in a southeastern suburb of Paris had not all been submerged at the same time. Examinations revealed signs of violence on two of them, prompting the Créteil prosecutor's office to open two separate murder investigations.

title: In France, accessible beaches help 'normalize vacations' for all
subhead: The 'Handiplage' label, awarded to 150 beaches across France, guarantees people with reduced mobility access to the water and amphibious wheelchairs for swimming.

title: Haitham Karajay, chef: 'My mother cooked every day. I was lucky to have her by my side until she died'
subhead: 'Refugee Recipes' (6/6). Chef Haitham Karajay sought refuge in France to escape from the Syrian civil war. He quickly turned to cooking, with the support of the NGO Refugee Food, for which he now works.

title: China's robotics industry surges amid promise of a $5 trillion market
subhead: From a global conference to robotic games inside the National Stadium, Beijing becomes the world capital of robots from August 8 to 17. The event showcases China's extraordinary acceleration in this sector – from automated industrial arms to AI-powered humanoids.
byline: By Vincent Fagot and Jordan Pouille (Beijing (China), correspondent)

Once a rarity in France, temperatures above 40°C have become increasingly common with climate change
subhead: This threshold, which long remained unusual, has been surpassed much more frequently since the start of the 21st century. The affected area is also expanding further north.

title: Video: Europe battles wildfires fueled by heatwave
subhead: The prolonged heatwave scorching Europe is fueling increasingly intense wildfires, driven by climate change.

title: Who's going to lie down on the couch? 'The Sopranos,' the first TV series to tackle mental health
subhead: 'Breaking The Script' (3/5). In 1999, the TV series 'The Sopranos' introduced viewers to a mafia boss suffering from depression. Through the intense exchanges between this anti-hero and his therapist, mental health became a central theme on television for the first time, where it has continued to thrive ever since.
